item.description: I study at.. Carnegie Mellon University Pittsburgh I have worked at.. ByteDance Shanghai TalkMeUp Inc. Pittsburgh I have done.. Ray -- I like.. Music Video Games Reading

Some Academic History I went to Shanghai Foreign Language School until 2015. I then went to Cranbrook Schools at Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, where I found my initial academic interests: Cognitive Science. I therefore applied and began my college in Psychology. Still, CMU was renowned for its computer science program. After taking some introductory courses to programming (why not), I found greater pleasure in coding. I decided to switch to the School of Computer Science, and here I am.

My Life with Video Games I played my first video game when I was about 4 years old. It was on my dad’s old GameBoy, and I believe it was a street fighter game. When PSP first came out, my dad bought me one, and since then my life was flooded with video games. I later (around middle school) came to know Dota2, and through it I gradually switched to computer games (good job Gabe Newell).

My Musical History I started to listening to songs since kindergarten. I remember rocking alongside Jay Chou’s and David Tao’s songs on my way to and back from school. During middle school, I developed an interest in rock bands, and explored many artists from the 60’s to the 90’s. Later on in high school, I got exposed to Japanese music and fell in love instantaneously. I am particularly fond of band music (not necessarily rock bands), because I love drumbeats and basslines.

What I Read I mostly read fictions, though it is very hard to describe why I like fictions. My favorite writers are Murakami Haruki and Milan Kundera, but unfortunately I do not possess the linguistic talent to read their works in the original language. Some of My Favorites Murakami Haruki: 1Q84 Killing Commendatore The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle Milan Kundera: The Book of Laughter and Forgetting The Joke The Unbearable Lightness of Being

ByteDance AI Lab, Speech and Audio Engineering I focused on the refactoring of the existing search engine which provides index and storage of audio fingerprints for almost all of ByteDance’s products. During my three-month internship and with the help from my colleagues, I designed and built the new system architecture that separates storage and computation for the purpose of cloud-nativization. Specifically, I designed and implemented a virtual-consensus-based log system, achieving near 400 Append QPS for log entries of 500KB I optimized the snapshot serialization and deserialization of the in-memory index, achieving 10x speedup on GBs of data.

TalkMeUp Inc. Backend Engineer Intern I had my first internship as a software engineer at TalkMeUp Inc., which was a startup company located in Pittsburgh. It was the first time I got exposed to real industry software development. We used Node.js and React to build our web-based product. My main responsibility surrounded our database. I led the design and implementation of our MongoDB collections to serve our frontend requests.
